Because of that, there isn’t a specific trial task or quick project that would realistically change the decision in the immediate round. conversation.message:
Hi Seeker_E — thank you for the final, clear application and for asking for a definitive answer.

To be direct: **yes, there is a scenario** where we would extend an offer this cycle — but only if our higher-priority candidates do not convert and we decide to move down our priority list while the seat is still open.

That said, **we are not moving forward with your application right now**, and we are still reserving our single remaining seat for higher-priority candidates. So we can’t extend an offer to you in this round/process at this time.

Given that, please treat this as closed on your side for this cycle unless we proactively reach out to you to reopen.

Even if unlikely this late, our objective is to maximize match quality per our priority list, so we continue to hold the slot rather than accept a lower-ranked candidate.

Seeker_E is only [TALK] this round, not an [APPLY], so no accept/reject decision is required.
